WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: MRS. REGINA ANDERSON
Address: SPRING VALLEY
Birthplace: __________________

1. INTEROCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1907
Where did you set up housekeeping? Prairie, around Spring Valley
Where had you been living before that? Regina, 1907-1908
For how many people did you prepare meals? Three
How far was it to your nearest store? About 2 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? About twice a year
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Sugar, flour, salt, coffee, tea
